name: Podollan Inn

reviews.text: I travelled to Salmon Arm on a very last minute trip for one night. I called the Podollan Inn and they were full except for the honeymoon suite. The cost for the suite for one night was more than I wanted to spend for one evening and I was not honeymooning! The clerk I spoke with spoke to her manager and gave me a significant discount in order to help me as the other hotels were booked up as well. The service was great, the room was lovely with a fabulous view of the hills and the pool area. I think my favorite part was the bed and the linens! I need to find out what type of beds they are because I had the best sleep of my life! The linens were top quality and the room was spacious and very clean. Definitely stay at the Podollan Inn, it doesn`t feel like your typical hotel but much more personal with the added bonus of a great night sleep! :)
reviews.title: Amazing bed! Best sleep I have ever had in a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I AM WRITING ABOUT THE ONE IN SALMON ARM, I am sure the other ones are just as great. This place is unbelievable, and impeccable. I can not say enough how beautiful the beds, the grounds, the fountains, the hot tub, the beautiful pools, the staff are. This is a top notch place to stay and is worth every penny. I loved it. Go, you will too!!!!
reviews.title: Best Hotel I have been to in Canada

reviews.text: We booked our stay here based on the website photos , and the allure of the pool.
reviews.title: Overpriced and in need of updating

reviews.text: If we could have we would have re-booked elsewhere the moment we walked into the room . Including taxes we paid almost $300 for a room that was no better than a Motel 8 .
reviews.title: great stuff

reviews.text: The finish in the room was amateur . The "closet" in the bedroom was a 1' piece of wire shelving attached to a wall . The duvet was dirty and stunk like someone elses body odor (thank god there was a clean sheet to go between us and it ). The sofa bed and chair were covered in 1970's green fake leather and where totally uncomfortable to sit on , and my daughter sleep on the sofabed with a metal bar pushing on her back all night , through the thin worn out mattress. The bathroom fittings were cheap and old.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!!!

reviews.text: This place is a bit pricey, but it's very nice, a step up from your average hotel.
reviews.title: Great pool

reviews.text: We stayed in the motel style wing, which is a bit cheaper but the rooms are nice, clean, and feel like a beach resort type of place, with balconies overlooking, or exiting into, the pool and gardens area.
reviews.title: Great hotel, will be back for sure!!

reviews.text: The pool is great. A long stretch with fountains leading to two circular areas. It's really big. It's warm enough, but it doesn't feel heated. The lake was warmer!
reviews.title: Extra Surchage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was really good, and very well priced, especially for a hotel of this quality.
reviews.title: If You Get the New Building - Great - Get The Old Building your in Troublee

reviews.text: Kids in our party were greeted with a scavenger hunt, which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Over priced but a pleasant stay

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a wedding near Salmon Arm. We only spent one night, but were very pleased with the hotel and would stay again. The rooms are large, extremely comfortable and clean. The beds are wonderful, soft and comfortable. We even had a nice view of the lake across the street. There is a beautiful outdoor pool which we wished we had time to enjoy. The staff at the hotel were very professional and friendly.
reviews.title: Beautiful comfy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are in the area. They have a group rate which makes it more affordable.
reviews.title: Comfy, comfy beds!!

reviews.text: My only complaint is the restaurant in the hotel. The restaurant is very convenient and the food is very good (although overpriced), however, the service is quite poor. The several times we went there we had to wait for everything, our drinks to be refilled, to receive our bill, etc. The servers didn't seem to be with it. I wouldn't recommend the restaurant unless you go there simply for convenience.
reviews.title: Worth every Kilometre...

reviews.text: We stayed here on our last night of a 2-week road trip. Needless to say, we've stayed at numerous hotels along the way. Our expectations never changed though, we want a clean room at a reasonable cost.
reviews.title: Could not have been more perfect...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Podollan Inns additionally provided easy to find location, super comfy beds, easy access to everything and lovely surroundings. Check in was very swift and efficient. We were in our room within 5 minutes of arriving and the room was HUGE! Two queen beds, a table with 2 chairs and still loads of room left over. Our room overlooked the empty pool, which made for a quiet night. I suspect it may have been noisier had the pool been open for the season.
reviews.title: A relaxing and pleasant stay

reviews.text: Too bad we didn't read the reviews on this hotel before we went to Salmon Arm. Judging by the beautiful pictures on the website and the expensive price we paid, we were looking very forward to our stay. When we pulled upto the "motel"...we looked at eachother wondering if we were at the wrong location. We arrived late afternoon and were told our room wasn't ready - they have a "guaranteed" room time of 3pm, and so if a guarantee isn't met, then what? We were told 2 girls "didn't show up" and therefore they're behind. What they didn't tell us was it would be over an hour wait for our room to be ready - and what they didn't know was we had a wedding to attend to at 5pm. We asked how we would be compensated for the inconvenience and they said they would "invite us to sit on the couches in the foyer." We laughed. Are they for real? As we were waiting, an employee walks in to start her shift and the girl at the front desk asked her how she was doing and her reply was "hungover...but i'll survive." Oh, that's classy. Exactly what we wanted to hear. Over an hour went by and our room was finally ready - when we got there we saw the manager and her highschool daughter putting the finishing touches on our room. We walked in and it was NOTHING like the pictures. That was the icing on the cake. They knew 4 people would be staying in the room and they only give 2 towels and 1 bar of soap. Smart. Upon checkout, they said they did all they could do to accomodate us as best as possible. We refused to take that as an answer and they decided to give us $10 off our room rate, which was nothing for the time wasted and TOTAL inconveniece of the whole stay. Friends of ours stayed at the Best Western and Super 8 and were treated like royalty for half the cost. I suggest you do the same!!!
reviews.title: Horrible, Rude and don't believe the pictures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish we had read the reviews first. Like others, we were taken in by the website photos and descriptions. On checking in we noticed that the bar and restaurant were not open for business, we had not been informed of this when we booked by phone. There were no suggestions as to where we could get dinner locally and having driven a very long distance, we did not want to get back in the car to look for somewhere to eat, we were just offered sandwiches! One good point was there was free internet access, so we searched there for local restaurants. My husband is coeliac and we asked at reception if gluten free bread could be available for breakfast (continental). The response was a very definite "no".
reviews.title: Can't believe this place is still in business..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious and clean but very dreary and particularly the bed cover was old and very shabby looking. The valance did not fit the bed. Nothing like the fresh, modern look in the website photos.
reviews.title: What A Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never saw any other guests in this hotel, it was gloomy, empty, and depressing.
reviews.title: Very Deceiving

reviews.text: Don't know what is going on with this place, can't believe that it's still in business. We left very early without breakfast.

description: Stay in our custom built, locally owned and operated luxury boutique hotel with all the features of local lifestyle, from individually decorated spacious rooms, free Wifi, to friendly caring staff, at an affordable price. Take in the cultural journey, the authentic lifestyle and experience the outdoor adventure of Salmon Arm, BC. We are close to everything. Imagine yourself in a Podollan Inn guest room with views of the Lake, mountains, or the pool, gardens and 18 acres of forested trails. Request a poolside room with a patio and relax outside with access to our stunning pool. Or enjoy a free pass to the aquatic centre. Taste local fresh flavours at Table 24, Triple Diamond rated. End your day in a pillow top bed with premium linens. Pets welcome.
